intro: Vincetoxicum virens, commonly known as green bittersweet, is a flowering plant belonging to the Loganiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves that are usually a vibrant green. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. These flowers are followed by bright orange-red berries that contain toxic seeds, making the plant potentially hazardous to humans and animals. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is often found in woodland areas or along hedgerows.
